newsitem.title: USA: UNIX systems up 12 pct to $34.3 billion in '96 - IDC.
newsitem.headline: UNIX systems up 12 pct to $34.3 billion in '96 - IDC.

text.p: Worldwide sales of computer systems running the UNIX operating system rose 12 percent to $34.3 billion in 1996, according to preliminary data released by International Data Corp on Wednesday.

IDC said its data includes UNIX-based personal computers, workstations, network servers, midrange systems and large systems. UNIX workstations, running RISC (reduced instruction set computing) processors, was the only segment to decline.
Lower cost servers based on Intel Corp PentiumPro chips running Microsoft Corp's Windows NT have begun to adversely impact low-end workstation sales, IDC said.
